metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29469 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in libxml2 before 2.10.4. When hashing empty dict strings in a crafted XML document, xmlDictComputeFastKey in dict.c can produce non-deterministic values, leading to various logic and memory errors, such as a double free. This behavior occurs because there is an attempt to use the first byte of an empty string, and any value is possible (not solely the '\0' value).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29469` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.7+esm5
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.7+esm5
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.7+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.7+esm5').
